AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa: defendant in a case involving illegal re-entry after deportation, sentenced to 90 months of imprisonment, native and citizen of Mexico, signed the Plea Agreement and Plea Agreement Addendum, pleaded guilty before a United States Magistrate Judge, has a history of violating immigration laws, alleges counsel was constitutionally ineffective, claims he was factually innocent of Illegal Re-entry due to potential United States citizenship, waived the right to appeal the sentence imposed and the right to contest his conviction or sentence by means of any post-conviction proceeding, testified that he understood the rights he was giving up by pleading guilty, knowingly and voluntarily pleaded guilty and waived his right to file a motion, made claims in his affidavit that were directly contradicted by his own statement in his Plea Agreement Addendum, failed to make a credible showing of deficient performance on the part of his counsel, entered a knowing and voluntary plea, appellant, has a family situation and is a member of a gang, claims United States citizenship, admitted to illegally re-entering the United States to reunite with his family, applied for derivative citizenship with the Department of Homeland Security
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Joseph M. Hood: Senior U.S. District Judge who signed the order granting the government's motion for summary judgment/motion to dismiss Valero's motion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: the government entity involved in the prosecution of Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa
